nodes.text: The North Ridge was a mountainous ridge on the planet Hoth. In 3 ABY, the Jedi Luke Skywalker was attacked by a wampa on the ridge, prompting his friend Han Solo to pass through the region while searching for him. The Imperial All Terrain Armored Transports of Blizzard Force later ascended the eastern end of the ridge on route to attack Echo Base, headquarters of the Alliance to Restore the Republic.

The North Ridge was a lengthy ridge of snow-covered mountains located on the planet Hoth. Its western end sat just south of Mount Ison, with the ridge running east along the southern edge of the Lanteel Glacier and then ending at the Kerane Valley.

In 3 ABY, the Jedi Luke Skywalker rode his tauntaun mount off the glacier into the North Ridge while attempting to investigate what he believed to be a meteor. A wampa then attacked him on the ridge, knocking him unconscious and then dragged Skywalker and his steed back off the ridge onto the glacier toward its cave. Skywalker's companion Han Solo later rode out on a tauntaun to search for his missing friend, passing through the ridge before locating him to the north.

When both Skywalker and Solo failed to return to Echo Base, the Alliance to Restore the Republic headquarters on Hoth, the T-47 airspeeders of Rogue Squadron were dispatched to search for the pair. When the squadron split up, Rogue Two pilot Zev Senesca began flying along the North Ridge from its western end, changing course toward the Lanteel Glacier when he picked up sensor readings over the ridge.

When the Galactic Empire later discovered the presence of Echo Base, it deployed the All Terrain Armored Transports of Blizzard Force onto the Moorsh Moraine to the far east of the ridge. The walkers Blizzard One and Blizzard 2 then crossed the Kerane Valley and ascended the North Ridge on a zig-zag path, emerging at the to amidst fog. Blizzard Four, which had unsuccessfully attempted a more easterly route toward Echo Base, then also ascended the North Ridge on a straighter path than the previous walkers.
The North Ridge first appeared in the 1980 original trilogy film, Star Wars: Episode V The Empire Strikes Back.
